intro: Meiogyne hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy meiogyne, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Meiogyne hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
